  • Infection control: Sinapi non-PVC urine meter repels microorganisms.
  • Tap design: Keeps your fingers far away from the outlet and inhibits cross infection.
  • Ease of use: Accessible sampling port, durable non-staining drainage bag and an easy to read high capacity rigid holder allows for greater ease of use.

line_type=”Small Line” line_alignment=”default” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”extra-color-2″ custom_height=”40″ custom_line_width=”300″][vc_column_text text_direction=”default”]1.Reduction in incidence of CAUTIs:

  • PVC-free urine collection bag.
  • Hydrophobic surface with repellent properties.
  • Reduced microbial contamination and colonization during urine catheterization.
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]
* Holesova et al, 2019; Trautner et al, 2004; Percival et al, 2015.
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text text_direction=”default”]2. Inhibition of cross infection in ICU:

  • Outlet slide cover on tap prevents tap contamination.
  • Compact device hangs at a safe height from floor to prevent contamination of tap.
  • Designed to assist with the management of oliguria in the critical care setting.
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]
* Lopez-Lopez et al, 1991; Evelyn et al, 2014; Matthay et al, 2020.
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column column_padding=”padding-10-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”padding-20-percent” column_padding_position=”left-right” column_border_style=”solid” column_padding_type=”default” gradient_type=”default”][vc_column_text]

1. The effect on length of stay

Early patient mobilization shortens length of stay: patients mobilise up to three days faster, leave hospital 30-50% sooner, and incur up to 49% less costs.

LEVO is compact and lightweight and can be orientated in any way, helping patients mobilize.

Unique indicators assist in faster clinical decisions.

* Bertrandt et al, 2019

2. Safety and Complications

Maintains the seal, even if knocked over.
Tube clamping is never required.
Safe and easy patient transport.
Simplicity equals safety.

* Mattoli et al, 2008

3. Addresses ICU nurse shortage

OR: Connect & drain, no setup
ICU: Saves time, simple to use
Easy patient mobilisation
No need to replace canisters
Less training required
Less complications

* Xu et al, 2021

4. Approved for outpatient management

Low probability for user error & complications.
Patients can perform self-care activities with reduced risk of harm.
Lower probability of hospital acquired infections.

* Massongo et al, 2014

5. Fewer units used

Only one LEVO needed per chest catheter.
Fewer canisters are procured, stored and discarded as medical waste.
LEVO saves costs at every step of the supply & ‘in-use’ chain.

* Abdulsalam et al, 2019

  • Early mobility and chest catheter removal:
    LEVO fully enables early mobility protocols as presented by the ERAS society. The monitoring features offered together with early mobility enables early chest catheter removal
  • Time:
    Shorter setup, easy management, easy drainage of the collection chamber
  • Cost savings:
    Early mobility and chest catheter removal lead to increasingly large cost savings for the healthcare centre in the long run
